meanings.definition: A covering for the head, usually with a visor and a close-fitting crown.
meanings.sent1: I wore my red capa to protect my head from the sun.
meanings.sent2: The soldier's capa shielded him from the rain during the march.
meanings.sent3: The capa flew off in the wind, making me chase after it comically.
meanings.sent4: Her capa of confidence never wavered, even in challenging situations.
meanings.sent5: The capa was so bright and colorful, it stood out in the crowd.

meanings.sent1: The capa of the mountain was covered in snow.
meanings.sent2: She carefully placed the capa back on the bottle.
meanings.sent3: The capa of the cake was decorated with tiny sugar flowers.
meanings.sent4: The capa of the tree reached high into the sky, touching the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The capa of the building gleamed in the sunlight, reflecting the sky.

meanings.definition: The ability or power to do something.
meanings.sent1: With his capa for music, he could play any instrument beautifully.
meanings.sent2: Her capa to lead the team was evident in how well they worked together.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed its capa for catching mice by bringing one home every day.
meanings.sent4: His capa to learn new languages amazed everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The capa to heal others was a gift she cherished and used wisely.

meanings.definition: A layer or coating on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The capa of paint on the wall was a vibrant shade of blue.
meanings.sent2: The car's capa of dust indicated it hadn't been used in a while.
meanings.sent3: She added a capa of icing on top of the cupcakes for extra sweetness.
meanings.sent4: The capa of frost on the grass sparkled in the morning sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The capa of snow blanketed the town, creating a winter wonderland.
